alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 9:36AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR RIPOGENUS DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release at Ripogenus Dam continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas near the West Branch of the Penobscot River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM EST, an upstream floodgate release at Ripogenus Dam is expected to cause minor flooding near the Abol Bridge Campground. Southern portions of Baxter State Park along the Appalachian Trail north of Abol Bridge including the Kiosk Area at Abol Bridge are flooded. - Backwater flooding is also possible on the following streams... Foss and Knowlton Brook, Nesowadnehunk Stream, Chesuncook Stream and Trail Brook. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ripogenus and Baxter State Park. - Discharge at the Ripogenus Dam is approximately 9976 cfs. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
